PageTitle: info-center source channel (Virtual access port-extension view)
FuncDef:
The info-center source channel command sets rules for AP outputting information through information channels.
The undo info-center source channel command deletes the rules for AP outputting information through information channels.
The default settings of log, trap, and debugging information in the record vary with information channel. For details, see Usage Guidelines.
CLIs: info-center source { <module-name> | default } channel { <channel-number> | <channel-name> } [ log { state { off | on } | level <severity> } * | trap { state { off | on } | level <severity> } * | debug { state { off | on } | level <severity> } * ] *
undo info-center source { <module-name> | default } channel { <channel-number> | <channel-name> } [ log { state | level } * | trap { state | level } * | debug { state | level } * ] *

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a module.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-insensitive characters. The name cannot contain spaces.

Specifies the number of the channel to be set.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9.

Specifies the name of the channel to be set.
The value is a string of 1 to 30 case-insensitive characters. The name cannot contain spaces or special characters, such as hyphens (-), slashes (/), or backslashes (\).

Sets the level of the information, so that the information with a higher level than the configured severity is not output.
The value is an enumerated type: emergencies,alert,critical,error,warning,notification,informational,debugging.

Sets the level of the information, so that the information with a higher level than the configured severity is not output.
The value is an enumerated type: emergencies,alert,critical,error,warning,notification,informational,debugging.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-virtual-access-portextend] info-center source bgp channel channel6 level emergencies
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A default record for each information channel exists. The module name is default, and the module ID is 0xffffffff. The default settings of this record for logs, traps, and debugging information may vary according to information channels. When there is no explicit configuration record for a module in a channel, the default record is used.
Channels 0 and 1: For a specified module, the default configuration is as follows:
For log information, state is on, and severity is warning.For trap information, state is on, and severity is debugging.For debugging information, state is on, and severity is debugging.
Channel 2: For a specified module, the default configuration is as follows:
For log information, state is on, and severity is informational.For trap information, state is on, and severity is debugging.For debugging information, state is off.
Channels 3 and 5: For a specified module, the default configuration is as follows:
For log information, state is off.For trap information, state is on, and severity is debugging.For debugging information, state is off.
Channel 4: For a specified module, the default configuration is as follows:
For log information, state is on, and severity is warning.For trap information, state is off.For debugging information, state is off.
Channels 6, 7, 8, and 9: For a specified module, the default configuration is as follows:
For log information, state is on, and severity is debugging.For trap information, state is on, and severity is debugging.For debugging information, state is off.
If a module generates plenty of logs, traps, or debugging information in a short time, specify the following parameters to suppress them:
levelseverity: adjusts the level of an information channel so that the information whose level is lower than the specified severity is filtered out.state off: disables all information sent by the specified module.
If you configure the severity of information for a channel, traps with a lower level than the specified severity may be filtered out.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
